questions.question_text:
As part of the ‘closing a project’ process, the project manager needs to assess whether the outcomes are likely to deliver the expected performance improvements post-project.

In which step of 'business case management' technique should the project manager assess this?

discussion.content: Correct, if you are confused like I am with Plan, do , act, check, you are correct. ITs not Deming Prince2 had to make up their own steps. Develop, Check, Maintain, and Confirm.

choices.C: Agreeing a work package with a team manager to deliver products within agreed Tolerances
choices.A: Encouraging a project team to continue working on a particularly challenging product
choices.D: Seeking feedback from team members to ensure they are still aligned to the project's objectives
choices.B: Discussing protect objectives with key stakeholders during a requirements gathering workshop

questions.question_text: Which describes a management activity within a project?

discussion.content: C = Correct, terrible unnecessary wording might be D as-well.

questions.question_text: Which of the following can be done to control the size of the Project Board on a project that involves multiple users and suppliers?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Create user and supplier groups: In PRINCE2, if a project involves multiple users and suppliers, creating user and supplier groups is a way to streamline communication and decision-making. These groups allow the project to represent the interests of various users and suppliers without expanding the size of the Project Board. The group leaders can then provide input to the Project Board, ensuring it remains manageable while still considering the needs of all stakeholders.
There can be only ONE Project Board for a project

choices.A: Create a separate Project Board to manage the supplier elements of the project
choices.B: Create multiple smaller Project Boards during the process of Starting up a Project, one for each of the project's stages.
choices.D: Appoint corporate quality assurance to perform the Project Assurance role for all members of the Project Board

questions.question_text:
Which TWO are objectives of the ‘closing a project’ process?

1. To confirm to the project board that each stage’s products are approved
2. To review whether the project was delivered within time and cost tolerances
3. To confirm whether operational staff are happy to take ownership of the products
4. To confirm that there is authority to close the project

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
La risposta è la C

Selected Answer: C
the answer is 100 percent C

C is correct; 
The "Closing a Project" process in PRINCE2 ensures that the project is formally closed in a controlled manner. Its key objectives include:

Confirming that operational staff are happy to take ownership of the products: Correct. Ensuring a smooth handover to operations or the users who will maintain and use the project's products is a crucial objective.

Confirming that there is authority to close the project: Correct. The project cannot be closed without explicit approval from the Project Board, ensuring all closure activities have been completed and the project's objectives reviewed.

A is correct; Why the other options are not correct:

B. Project brief: The project brief is a more detailed document that is created during the 'starting up a project' process. It expands on the information in the project mandate.
C. Work package: A work package is a set of tasks assigned to a team, usually within a specific stage of the project.
D. Project approach: The project approach describes the overall strategy and methods that will be used to manage the project.

questions.question_text: In the ‘starting up a project’ process, what is the PRINCE2 name for a ‘request for proposal’ received by an external supplier?
